page.title: 07A Bryanston Farmworker's Day
page.content: An employee on the{Home Farm}was asked about his work. He is a general farm labourer, working an{8hr basic {day}with breaks for breakfast & lunch. He has 4 weeks off & public holidays. The basic rate of pay is{Â£2.50 per {hour}gross; he is paid for overtime. He has a house provided free of rent & rates.Waterproofs for work are given. At the time of the interview he said the main problem on the farm was lack of grass because of the harsh winter. He is married with one child. In his spare time, he gardens & maintains his own animals.He trains for the rugby season, when he plays for Bournemouth. Because he was there & his father is on the staff, he keeps in touch with the School in a general way. He felt his family approved of his job, & they all keep in close touch with one another.
